text: Marian Adam Rejewski (; 16 August 1905 â€“ 13 February 1980) was a Polish mathematician and cryptologist. In 1932, he helped create the Enigma cipher machine. His invention helped Britain to begin reading German Enigma-encrypted messages. Rejewski died of a heart attack caused by heart disease on 13 February 1980 in Warsaw, Poland, aged 74. ==References== Category:1905 births Category:1980 deaths Category:German mathematicians Category:German inventors Category:Cryptography Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction
